# COVID India Model

COVID India model allows the simulation of different options before the Government of India to contain the COVID-19 pandemic. It provides a means to evaluate the impact of different options on new cases per day, total cases, total deaths and active cases. For a [explanation about the methodology and the results see](http://ssrn.com/abstract=3674767). This [ppt summarizes the results](https://github.com/AnupamSaraph/COVID-Simulation/blob/master/PPT/Covid%20India%20Model.pptx) of the different scenarios documented in the [paper](http://ssrn.com/abstract=3674767).


## Usage

**Run the model online** 

[![badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/COVID-India%20Model%20Reference%20Run-579ACA.svg?logo=data:image/png;base64,)](https://mybinder.org/v2/gh/AnupamSaraph/COVID-Simulation/master?filepath=COVID-India-Model%2Fcovid_india_reference_run.ipynb)

[![badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/COVID-India%20Model%20Explore%20Scenarios-E66581.svg?logo=data:image/png;base64,)](https://mybinder.org/v2/gh/AnupamSaraph/COVID-Simulation/master?filepath=COVID-India-Model%2Fcovid_india_automatic_scenarios.ipynb)



To **run the model offline**, you will need to install the model code and requirements. These files have not yet been added to the repository, this file will change when they are.

Use pip to install COVID-India-model:

```shell
   $ pip install COVID-India-model
```

Or use conda:

```conda
   $ conda install COVID-India-model
```
Then download and follow instruction in the notebooks to run the code that calls the model simulator and produce the outputs.

* [covid_india_reference_run.ipynb](https://github.com/AnupamSaraph/COVID-Simulation/covid_india_reference_run.ipynb)
* [covid_india_automatic_scenarios.ipynb](https://github.com/AnupamSaraph/COVID-Simulation/covid_india_automatic_scenarios.ipynb)

[covid_india_reference_run.ipynb](https://github.com/AnupamSaraph/COVID-Simulation/covid_india_reference_run.ipynb) compares the historical data with the simulation that includes the actions of the Government of India upto day 146. [covid_india_automatic_scenarios.ipynb](https://github.com/AnupamSaraph/COVID-Simulation/covid_india_automatic_scenarios.ipynb) enables you to simulate any interventions from any day for as many days as you like and generate.

If you set 
```python
sim.Show = True
``` 
in the notebook, the model outputs will be displayed in the interactive notebook. If you set 
```python
sim.Save = True
``` 
in the notebook, the results of the simulation will be saved in a folder with the version of the model (currently 6.00.00.2020).
